alert.note: Alert for Medina (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 2:11PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Medina and southern Bandera Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 211 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tarpley to Lakehills. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tarpley, Lakehills, Cliff, Bandera Falls, Hill Country State Natural Area, Mico, Rio Medina, Government Canyon State Natural Area and Lake Medina Shores. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
